src: ɯ-zda ra sɤz kɯ-mbro kɯ-fse
trs: Taller or higher than the others.' (elicited)

src: \textbf{zjaŋ} ʑo tɤ-ndzur
trs: He stood up suddenly, and (appeared to be) very tall.'  (elicited)

src: ɯ-βri nɯra kú-wɣ-rtoʁ qʰe ɲɯ-ɤcilaj ʑo qʰe, nɤkinɯ, ʁɟɯʁɟri ʑo ɲɯ-pa.
trs: The body (of the gecko) looks wet, it is wet and soft.' (28-tshAwAre, 39)

src: mbro ɯ-taʁ to-ɕe tɕe \textbf{zjaŋnɤzjaŋ} jɤ-ari-ndʑi
trs: He mounted the horse, and  they went there, very tall.'  (elicited)

src: `wo a-mu ma-pɯ-tɯ-ʑɣɤ-sat tɕe aʑo pjɯ-nɯ-ɣi-a ŋu' to-ti. pɣɤlpɣɤlnɤpɣɤlpɣɤl pjɤ-nɯ-ɣi.
trs: She said ``Mother, don't commit suicide, I am coming back'' and came back running in big strides.' (2003 kAndZWsqhaj2, 26-27)

src: zjaŋnɤlaŋ ɲɯ-ŋke
trs: He is walking unsteadily, very tall.'   (elicited)

src: pʰɯzjaŋ ʑo tɤ-ndzur
trs: He stood up suddenly, and (appeared to be) very tall.'  (elicited)

src: nɯ pʰɯqʰloŋ ʑo pjɤ-ɣɤrɤt
trs: He threw (the bag into the water), making a sudden splashing noise.' (150824 kelaosi-zh, 155)

src: a-ɣe \textbf{mɤlɤzjaŋ} ʑo tʰɯ-aβzu
trs: My grandson has become very tall.'  (elicited)

src: zjaŋɯŋi ʑo jɤ-ari
trs: He went away slowly (taller than rest).'  (elicited)

src: zjɯŋɯzjaŋi ɲɯ-xcat
trs: There are many (people), some taller and some shorter.'   (elicited)

src: mbro ta-nɯmbrɤpɯ tɕe zjaŋinɤzjaŋi ʑo jɤ-ɕqʰlɤt
trs: He mounted the horse and disappeared quickly (in the horizon), very tall.'  (elicited)

src: tu-mbri nɯra cutcutcut ʑo tu-ti ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: When it calls it makes `\forme{cut cut cut}'.' (24-ZmbrWpGa, 8)

src: ɲɯ-kɯ-sɤŋo tɕe, nɯ nɯ-ɬoʁ tɕe, zɯrzɯrzɯr tu-ti qʰe tɕendɤre tɤ-ndɤr ɲɯ-ɬoʁ ɕti.
trs: When it appears, one has an itchy feeling, and a pimple appears.' (25-khArWm, 4)

src: tɤɕi qaj nɯ tɤtɤɣ ɯ-ŋgɯ rɕɯβrɕɯβrɕɯβrɕɯβ ʑo pjɯ-lɤt nɯ, ɯ-zgra nɯ pjɤ-sɤ-mtsʰɤm.
trs: (In the night), one could hear the rustling noise of the (one-legged demon)$_i$ pouring barley and wheat grains into the cupboard (of the woman with whom he$_i$ was having a relationship). (140510 rkoNJAl, 32-33)

src: kú-wɣ-rtoʁ tɯ-mɲaʁ kɯ ɯ-mɤlɤjaʁ ra mɯ́j-saχsɤl ʑo ri, ``ʑeʑeʑeʑeʑeʑe" ʑo tu-ti ju-ɕe qʰe, ɯ-tɯ-mbjom sɤre ʑo
trs: (Of a type of small millipede) Looking at it, its feet are not clearly visible, but it moves making \forme{ʑeʑeʑeʑeʑeʑe}, extremely quickly.' (28-kWpAz, 155)

src: ɯ-mɤlɤjaʁ kɯra nɤ kɯra tu-ste qʰe tɕe, iɕqʰa staχpɯrɟɤskʰi ɣɯ ɯ-jwaʁ nɯ xɯrinɤxɯri ʑo tu-sɯ-mtɕɯr.
trs: (There is a species of insect which) does this with its legs repeatedly, and rotates the leaves of the \forme{staχpɯrɟɤskʰi} very quickly.' (18-NGolo, 139)

src: li mbalɤ-pɯ nɯ ɣɯ ɯ-qom ra rɯβnɤrɯβ ʑo ɲɤ-ɬoʁ ɕti qʰe
trs: The tears of the calf flowed, dripping without stop.' (140512 fushang he yaomo-zh, 136)

src: ɯ-kɤ-nɯzdɯɣ ɲɯ-dɤn tɕe, ɯ-sɯm rɯwɯrawi ɲɯ-xtsu
trs: He is worried about many things, and he feels upset and confused.' (elicited)

src: tɕeri nɯnɯ ɯ-rme nɯ dzoŋdzoŋ ɲɯ-pa
trs: The hair (on the squirrel's tail) is bristling.' (28-qapar, 135)

src: tu-ŋke-a tɕe a-mi dzoŋnɤdzoŋ ʑo ɲɯ-ti ma cʰɤ-ndʑɯrpɯt
trs: My foot feels itchy as I walk, because it was numb.' (elicited)

src: xɕelwi rcanɯ, tɯ-se nɯ ku-tsʰi nɤ ku-tsʰi, (...) ɯ-xtu nɯ \textbf{xtʂóŋ}.xtʂoŋ ʑo ɲɯ-pa ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: The tick drink one's blood again and again, (...) so that its belly become bloated.' (25-xCelwi, \japhdoi{0003664\#S42})

src: tɕe ma nɯnɯ tu-fka xtʂoŋxtʂoŋ ʑo ŋu.
trs: (The tick) is full (from having drunk blood) and bloated.' (25-xCelwi, 59)

src: ɯ-χpɯm dzoʁ ʑo pjɤ-tsʰoʁ
trs: (The demon) immediately knelt down.' (140513 abide he mogui-zh, 47)

src: tɤ-pɤtso ra dɯxpa-nɯ matɕi tɕendɤre, zgoʁnɤzgoʁ ʑo nɯ-χpɯm ta-tsʰoʁ-nɯ tɕe
trs: The poor children, they knelt (before the ogre) one after the other.' (160704 poucet4-v2, 42)

src: ɯ-phoŋbu nɯ rcanɯ ʁɲɟlíʁɲɟli ʑo ɲɯ-pa.
trs: Its body, it is enormous.' (20-sWNgi, 16)

src: aʑo grɯβgrɯβ ɯ-ftsa nɯ tɤ-kɯ-qawɤr ma nɯ ma χploʁχploʁ kɯ-pa mɯ-pɯ-mto-t-a
trs: The (mushroom called) the `matsutake's nephew', I have seen ones with opened caps, but never seen one in ball shape (before the cap opens).' (23-grWBgrWBftsa, 5)

src: ɯ-ru nɯra nɯ-rom tɕe rʁɤβrʁɤβ tu-pa ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: Once it has dried, its stalk becomes very rough.' (14-sWNgWJu, 22)

src: ʑɯrɯʑɤri qʰe li tɤ-se nɯ to-mbat qʰe, li tɤrmbɣo nɯ dɯrnɤdɯr pjɤ-pa
trs: Progressively, the blood (in the lake) started to recede, and there was again a drumming sound far away.' (2003-kWBRa, 106)

src: ɕkɤrnɤlɤr ʑo kɯ-pa nɯ jo-nɯ-ɣi
trs: He came back home limping.' (140429 jiedi-zh, 141)

src: ɯ-tʰoʁ tɕu zɟɯɣ ʑo ti ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: (The stone) made a loud noise (as it fell) on the ground.' (The 2003 tWxtsa, 76)

src: cʰɯ-tɯt ɕɯŋgɯ tɕe tɕe tú-wɣ-ndza tɕe, tɕʁɯznɤtɕʁɯz tu-ti ɲɯ-ŋu tʰɯ-tɯt ɯ-qʰu tɕe tɕe tɤ́-wɣ-ndza tɕe, zwaʁnɤzwaʁ tu-ti ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe, nɯ ɲɯ-mɯm.
trs: If one eats (an apple)$_i$ before it$_i$ is ripe, it makes a crunchy sound, when it is ripe, it makes a soft (not crunchy) sound, it is (more) tasty (in this case because it has become sweeter and less sour).' (07-paXCi, 27-28)

src: tu-kɯ-ti kɯnɤ ɕɲɯɣ ʑo tu-ti tu-mŋɤm ŋu
trs: (When suffering from this disease), one feels intense pain even when one talks.' (29-RzAr, 35)

src: ɯ-sŋɯro lu-lɤt tɕe ɬɯɣnɤɬɯɣ, ɬɯɣnɤɬɯɣ tu-ste ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: When (the frog)$_i$ breathes, it$_i$ expands and retracts (its whole body) with each breath.' (27-qaCpa, 3)

src: spɣi ɲɯ-nɯ-te ndɤre, nɤki rɟɤlpu tu-ɕe rcanɯ, tu-rɤjoʁβzɯr kɯ-fse rcanɯ, nɤki, χtsʰɤχtsʰɤt ʑo tu-ʑɣɤ-stu tɕe, ku-rɤʑi pɯ-ŋu, βdaʁmu tu-ɕe rcanɯ, pʰɤtɕʰɯχtɤr ʑo pjɯ-te tɕe, qɯqlɯ ʑo tu-ʑɣɤ-stu tɕe ku-rɤʑi pɯ-ŋu ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The king)$_i$ put (the bird)$_j$ in the attic. When the king$_i$  would go up there, it$_j$ would clean everything up and would be lively; when the queen would go up there, it$_j$ would make a mess and have a hangdog look.' (2003 Kunbzang, 302-4)

src: tɕe nɯ kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi ʑo ɲɯ́-wɣ-mbi tɕe ma ɕŋɤβ ʑo tu-ʑɣɤ-stu tɕe ju-nɯ-mɟe tɕe tu-ndze ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: We would give (our turtle)$_i$ a little piece$_j$ (of meat), and it$_i$ would grab it$_j$ with a snapping noise and eat it$_j$.' (140510 wugui, 23)

src: [kɯ-ɣɯrni ʑo tsɣaʁtsɣaʁ] ci ŋu tɕe
trs: It (a type of millipede) is brilliant red.' (28-kWpAz, 152)

src: tɯ-ŋga ɯ-taʁ ra ɯ-mat bɤbɤβ ʑo ku-ndzoʁ.
trs: When one walks among (these plants), their fruits attach to one's clothes in clumps.' (18-qromJoR, 170)

src: rtɕʰɯʁjɯ ɣɯ ɯ-rme nɯ kɯ ɲɯ-kɯ-z-rɤʑa. nɯ tɯ-ɕa a-mɤ-nɯ-ɤtɯɣ ra ma tɤndɤr brɯɣbrɯɣ ʑo tu-tɕɤt ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: The caterpillar's hair itches people, it should not touch one's flesh, otherwise it will cause a lot of little pimples to appear.' (25-rtchWRjW, 86-88)

src: ma nɯnɯ ɕawurambɯm tu-ti-nɯ tɕe nɯnɯ, nɤkinɯ, [[tɯ-rdoʁ ʑo \textbf{zɟɤɣzɟɤɣ}] ma] kɯ-me ɲɯ-ŋu kʰi
trs: People call it `Shwaba rwa'bum', it is (a kind of deer antler) with only one (branch), short and thick.

src: <donglang> ɯʑo-sti nɯnɯ, [tɤ-tɕɯ tɯ-rdoʁ ndzɤrndzɤr] ma nɯ ma kɯ-tu pjɤ-me.
trs: There remained only Donglang, the boy, all alone (on earth after his family had been taken away).' (150828 donglang, 134)

src: nɯra tɤ-stu-t-a tɕe,  sɯŋgɯnaχtɕɯn \textbf{ndɤrndɤr} ʑo nɯ-stu-t-a, ɯ-taʁ,  pɣa \textbf{ɲcɣɤnɤɲcɣɤt} ʑo ɲɯ-mbri tɕe
trs: I acted this way, I created a huge and deep forest on the top of whose trees birds are tweeting and chirping and flying around.' (2011-04-smanmi, 220-221)

src: tɤ-ɣɤndʐo tɕe `ɯtɕʰɯtɕʰɯ' ma-tɯ-ti,   tɤ-sɤɕke tɕe (nɤkinɯ) `atsatsa' ma-tɯ-ti, kɯ-mŋɤm tɤ-tu tɕe `atsatsa' ma-tɯ-ti ra
trs: When you feel cold, don't say ``Ah'', when you feel hot, don't say ``ouch'', when you  feel pain, don't say ``ouch''.' (07-deluge, 66-68)

src: srɯtpʰu srɯnmɯ kɯ-fse kɯ-sɤ-ɣmɯ\redp{}ɣmu ʑo ɲɤ-k-ɤtɯɣ-ndʑi-ci ri,  `wudzɯdzi' mɯ-to-ti.
trs: They met fearsome râkshasas and râkshasîs, but he did not say `how frightful!'.' (31-deluge, 116)

src: aɕi! ɲɯ-tɯ-ɣɤŋgi.
trs: Of course (I take back what I have said)! You are right.' (2003 tWxtsa, 44)

src: wo a-mu a-kɯm ɣɯ-tɤ-ci
trs: Mother, come and open the door for me!' (2012 tWJo, 23)

src: ɲɯ-tɯ-fse nɤ tsatsatsa, mɯ́j-tɯ-fse nɤ tsatsatsa
trs: One can say that you look like her, but one can also say that you don't.' (2014-kWlAG, 476)

src: tɤ-tɕɯ nɯ kɯ ``wortɕʰi nɤ wojɤr ʑo" to-ti ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: The boy said `please' (several times).' (qachGa 2012, 81)

src: ɯnɯnɯ tɕendi <wazi> nɯ ɯ-mdoʁ wuma ʑo ɲɯ-ɤsɯ-ndo. woja, nɯnɯ kɯ-fse ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: It has the colour of the socks over there. Yes, it is like that.' (23-grWBgrWBftsa, 48)

src: lɯlu jú-wɣ-no tɕe ``tɕʰa" tu-kɯ-ti ŋu
trs: When one chases a cat, one says \forme{tɕʰa}.' (06-huchements2, 14)

src: tɕe ɯʑo kɯ-ɤskɯ a-pɯ-ŋu qʰe ``aβleβle rgɯskɯ" tu-kɯ-ti qʰe tɕe ɯʑo tso ɕti qʰe ju-nɯ-ɣi ɕti
trs: If (the cow) has white colour on the back (and given the name \forme{rgɯskɯ}), one says \forme{aβleβle rgɯskɯ} and she understands, and comes by herself.' (06-huchements1, 3)

src: nɯnɯ tɕe, pɕi ku-rɤʑi ɕti tɕe, nɤki nɯ, iɕqʰa nɯ, kʰa ɯ-ŋgɯ ju-ɣi mɤ-ŋgrɤl
trs: That one (the wild cat), it stays outside, it does not come inside houses (unlike the domestic cat).' (21-lWLU, 6-7)

src: ``ja" tɤ-ti ma tɕe mɯ́j-kʰɯ.
trs: Say `ya', otherwise (I) can't (tell the story).' (160720 kandZislama, 003)

src: pɤkʰije tɕe <guan> ma-kɤ-tɯ-βze je!
trs: Wait, don't hang up (your phone).' (conversation, 2015-07-05)

src: aʑo cʰɯ-ɣi-a je ma mɤ-pʰan-a nɤ mɤ-ʁdɯɣ-a tʰaŋ nɤ
trs: Let me come along, even if I am of no use, I will not do any harm.' (several occurrences)

src: a-wi tɕʰorzi ɯ-ŋgɯ pjɯ-kɯ-rku-a je
trs: Grandmother, put me in the jar, and...' (2005 Kunbzang, 346)

src: kɤnɤβdi je a-mu!
trs: Take care, mother!' (Gesar,54)

src: kʰu nɯ ʁo nɯ-βde wo, a-me nɯ χtanɤ a-ftsaʁ ɯβrɤ-ɣi ma
trs: My daughter, don't worry about the tiger, (I am more worried) that my (house) could have a roof leak.' (khu 2005, 5)

src: kɯki li pjɯ-mnat-a ɕi?
trs: Do I tell (the story) again?' (150908 menglang-zh, 1)

src: nɯʑora smi cʰɯ-tɯ-nɯ-βlɯ-nɯ ŋu ɕi, <dian> cʰɯ-tɯ-nɯmbjɯm-nɯ ŋu?
trs: Do you burn a fire, or do you get warm with (an) electric (radiator)?' (conversation, 2013-12-13)

src: kɯki a-χpi ki ɲɯ-mpɕɤr ɕi mɯ́j-mpɕɤr?
trs: Is this story of mine beautiful or not?' (140512 fushang he yaomo-zh, 190)

src: a-rcɤmbe-ŋga nɯ ŋotɕu nɯ-a<nɯ>ri kɯ?
trs: Where did my beggar (wearer of an old jacket) of a husband vanish?' (2005 Kunbzang, 231)

src: kɯβdesqafsum-pa to-tsu, ɣe? woja, nɯ to-tsu
trs: (How many years have passed since 1969?), 43 years have passed, right? Yes, that many years have passed.' (12-BzaNsa, 15)

src: hehe kɯ-lɤɣ acɤβ, kɯ-sat-a ɲɯ-ŋu nétɕi?
trs: Shepherd Askyabs, you are preparing to kill me, right?' (2003 Kunbzang, 337)

src: ``tʂʰa mbuz ɲɯ-ŋu" to-ti-a ŋu nétɕi?
trs: I said `The tea is abouyt to spill over', didn't I?' (26-tAGe, 15)

src: nɤʑo nɤ-tɕɯ tɯ-sla to-mtsʰɤt loβtɕi?
trs: Your son is now more than one month old, right? (conversation 2013-12-02)

src: tɯ-rdoʁ tsa rɤʑi-j tɕe tú-wɣ-qur-nɯ raʁmaʁ
trs: How about only one of us staying (here) and helping them?'  (180503 xiyouji 12-zh, 78)

src: ɯ-jaʁmu ra to-tɕɤt kʰi, wo, tɕendɤre kɯ-ɣɤrʁaʁ nɯ kɯ kɤ-nɯɕɤmɯɣdɯ mɯ-pjɤ-cha kʰi.
trs: (They say that the monkey mother) stuck out her thumb (as a sign meaning `now you can shoot'),\footnote{For the context of this example, see (\ref{ex:ra.WskAt.ra.toBzu}) (§\ref{sec:nouns.speech.complement}).} but the hunter could not shoot.' (19-GzW, 75-76)

src: kɯ-dɤn tsa tɯtɯrca ku-rɤʑi-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu, ɲɯ-ŋu kʰi
trs: They stay together in great number (on remote cliffs), it is said' (20-ldWGi, 12)

src: ki kɯ-fse kɯ-ɤrɤmbɯmbri ʑo kɯ-fse tu-ɬoʁ ɲɯ-ŋu. ɲɯ-ŋu kʰi ma, aj mɯ-pɯ-mto-t-a
trs: (The mushroom \textit{Hericium erinaceus}) grows in patches (not spread evenly). So they say, I have not seen it.' (23-mbrAZim, 184)

src: pɣɤkʰɯ nɯ kɯ qaɲi kɤ-sat wuma ʑo \textbf{cʰa} kʰi.
trs: The owl is very good at killing moles, it is said.' (28-qapar, 205)

src: nɯ a-tɤ-fse tɕe tɕetʰa,  ɬɤndʐi nɯ kɯ tʰa ``iʑora ɯ-me ɲɯ-ŋu" a-nɯ-sɯsɤm tɕe, mɤ́-wɣ-ndza-j tʰaŋ
trs: (If we do it) this way, the ogre$_i$ will think that we are his$_i$ daughters and maybe he$_i$ will not eat us. (160705 poucet5-v2, 32-33)

src: tɕetʰa tu-ɕe-a ma kʰapa ri ku-nɤŋkɯŋke-a tɕetʰa, nɤkinɯ, <zayin> tu tʰaŋ
trs: I will go up (to my house) because (now) I am walking in the yard, there could be noise (so that we won't hear each other on the phone).' (conversation 2016-02-21)

src: jinde kɤntɕʰɯ-sŋi kɤ-mto pɯ-me tɕe, pjɤ-si rca
trs: (We) haven't seen him for several days, he probably died.' (150827 mengjiangnv-zh,157)

src: tɕe kɯɕɯŋgɯ tɕe, nɤki, tɯ-tɯpɯ raŋri ɣɯ nɯ-kha nɯtɕu kʰɤβɣa pjɤ-tu rca.
trs: In former times, there used to be handmills in every house, presumably (now they have disappeared).' (160705 khABGa, 23)

src: mŋɤm mɤ-mŋɤm mɤ-xsi ri, kú-wɣ-rtoʁ ndɤre mɯ́j-pe ko.
trs: I don't know whether (leprosy) hurts or not, but in any case it does not look good indeed.' (25-khArWm, 60-61)

src: ɲɯ-mbri ɯmɤ-kɯ-ŋu-ci ma.
trs: It looks like (my phone) is ringing.' (160630 abao,-zh, 98)

src: li ɯβrɤ-ɲɯ-jmɯt-a ma.
trs: I might forget again (some details of the story that I am about to tell again).' (160704 poucet4-v2, 1)

src: nɯ ɯ-tʰoʁ nɯra nɯ-kʰi nɯ ɣe, nɯ-tɯ-scit nɯ!
trs: The people on earth (on the ground), how lucky they are, right? How happy there are! (150828 donglang, 26)

src: ɯ-pi ni ɣɯ  fsapaʁ loβ, tɯjpu loβ, ɯ-grɤl kɯ-me ʑo ta-rku-nɯ
trs: (Their parents) gave her two elder sisters cattle and food in great quantity.' (2005 Kunbzang, 151)
